definition: to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps

sentences.english: I'm afraid the hOtel's full on those dates.
sentences.chinese: 那幾天逸旅館恐怕都客滿了。

sentences.english: I can't go along with you on that, I'm afraid.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕在這一點上無不能認同你的說法。

sentences.english: I’m afraid I’ll have to give you a few stiches.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我得給你縫幾針了。

sentences.english: And it was thumbs-down for tattoos.
sentences.chinese: 對於紋身這恐怕是一個響雷。

sentences.english: I'm afraid the prices are fixed in this store.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能講價，本店是明碼標價。

sentences.english: I'm afraid you've spent too much time pottering about in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 你在園裏東遊西蕩，恐怕花的時間大多了吧。

sentences.english: There are few men in this world who get mad at graceful women.
sentences.chinese: 這個世上恐怕很少有男人會對閒雅的女人發脾氣。

sentences.english: I am afraid My Lover should also numb.
I figured the store would give us guff about exchanging it.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得要想把牀退回去恐怕要費一番脣舌。

sentences.english: The fear is that the next election, due next year, will follow the same course.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕明年的下一輪選舉也難逃相同的厄運。

sentences.english: No fishing off the fish people, I am afraid it is difficult to appreciate from the Mainland.
sentences.chinese: 沒有釣過魚的人，恐怕是難以領略到的。

sentences.english: They watched him closely in cottom he should escape.
sentences.chinese: 他們嚴密監視他，恐怕他會逃脫。

sentences.english: I'm afraid you're not quite right.
sentences.chinese: 我恐怕招待得很不周到。

sentences.english: B:I'm afraid we don'l have it in stock at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我們目前沒有存貨了。

sentences.english: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour's house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.
sentences.chinese: 你的腳要少進鄰舍的家，恐怕他厭煩你，恨惡你。

sentences.english: Lest the LORD see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕耶和華看見就不喜悅，將怒氣從仇敵身上轉過來。

definition: to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
to be certain/to be positive/assuredly/definitely/to give recognition/to affirm/affirmative (answer)
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
